channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don’t Do What I Did On Your Next Property…w/Craig Curelop
item.description: Can your mistakes make you a millionaire? If you’re like Craig Curelop and learn from what went wrong, then yes! Craig is now financially free, with millions of dollars in […]

item.title: Nurture wants to teach kids important life skills through interactive gameplay and entertainment
item.description: Parents understand the challenge of keeping young kids engaged in online learning. Nurture is a new app designed for children aged 4 to 7 that features interactive content and games to capture their interest. The company’s mission is to equip children with critical life skills such as socializing, basic financial understanding, mindfulness, fitness, nutrition, and […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Robert Roberson’s Death Penalty Case Shows How Justice System Fails People With Autism
item.description: He was convicted in his daughter’s death. Those who believe he’s innocent argue his diagnosis helps explain how he ended up facing execution.

item.title: Passive Investing 101: A Passive Path to Profit, Appreciation, & Tax Benefits
item.description: Visit PassivePockets, your resource for passive investing with syndications. Do you want to get into real estate without managing rentals and dealing with tenants? Passive real estate investing could be […]

item.title: Google nets court win against EU’s $1.7B AdSense antitrust decision
item.description: Google has succeeded in overturning a $1.7 billion antitrust penalty handed down by the European Union back in March 2019. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Could People Facing the Death Penalty Lose the Right to Tell Juries Their Life Stories?
item.description: Some defense lawyers fear that a conservative Supreme Court could overturn that precedent.

item.title: Uncovering the Patterns Behind Falling Rents in Sprawling Cities
item.description: Smart investors can target these areas with lasting growth potential.

item.title: 23andMe sees independent board directors quit en masse
item.description: 23andMe, the personal genomics company, went public in early 2021 via a merger with a blank check company that valued it at $3.5 billion. Then its fortunes began to sink. Fading interest in DNA kits – 23andMe’s main product – was one driver. So was news last year that hackers stole ancestry data on 6.9 […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Things to Know About How the Parkland Shooter’s Life Was Spared
item.description: Key takeaways from our investigation into how Nikolas Cruz’s defense team convinced jurors not to impose the death penalty.

item.title: How to Make Truly Passive Income with “Syndication” Real Estate
item.description: Visit PassivePockets, your resource for passive investing with syndications. Passive investing is most people’s goal, especially if they’re trying to achieve FIRE. They don’t want to be weighed down by […]

item.title: Governor Newsom on California AI bill SB 1047: ‘I can’t solve for everything’
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom said there are 38 bills on his desk that would create laws around artificial intelligence on Tuesday, but one looms larger than all of them: SB 1047, California’s bill that tries to prevent AI systems from causing catastrophes. For the first time, California’s Governor shared how he’s thinking about the controversial […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Hardest Case for Mercy
item.description: Inside the effort to spare the Parkland school shooter.

item.title: Banks Face Pressure to Fund Affordable Housing Projects, Opening an Opportunity for Investors
item.description: Banks are feeling pressure from the federal government to fund affordable housing projects, and they're pushing back. But in the middle of the fight is a possible profitability route for investors.

item.title: Amazon taps long-time exec to lead India business as competition intensifies
item.description: Amazon has named long-time executive Samir Kumar as the new head of its India consumer business, a month after its domestic business' head resigned. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Domestic Abuse Survivor to Prison Pipeline
item.description: Researchers surveyed people who kill their abusers. They found several complicated reasons why survivors end up in prison because of abuse.
